person.content:

Paragraph: Two ships loaded on the East Coast , three waited to load , six were due .

| Person |
| --- |
| Two ships (loaded) |
| Three ships (waited) |
| Six ships (were due) |

| Person |
| --- |
| Three ships (waited) |
| Six ships (were due) |

The "Two ships (loaded)" does not refer to specific persons, but rather to ships in general that have already loaded. Therefore, it is not considered a valid "Person" entity.

The paragraph does not contain any explicit mention of organizations, it only mentions the number of ships and their actions. The "East Coast" can be considered as a location where the ships are located, but it can also be considered as an organization that manages the coastline or port operations. Since the context of the paragraph does not provide enough information to confirm the organizational nature of "East Coast" with certainty, it is included as a potential organization in the table.
